Sentencas: In a segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell (SIS-SOFC), an interconnect (IC) provides electrical contact and sealing between the anode of one cell and the cathode of the next.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: A metallic silver-glass composite (SGC) is considered a promising alternative to ceramic IC materials in SIS-SOFCs.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: In this work, a simulation study is performed on a tubular SIS-SOFC to assess the effectiveness of the SGC-IC design and to predict the SOFC performance characteristics for various IC geometries and conductivities.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: The developed model provides detailed information on cell behavior, such as the internal resistance, the potential/current distribution, and the local gas species concentration.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that the SGC material greatly reduces a potential drop across the IC film.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: Thus, it provides the following substantial advantages over conventional ceramic IC materials: (i) increased power density and (ii) a larger degree of flexibility in the cell design.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations

Sentencas: Moreover, the validation test, i. e., comparison of the simulated results with the experimental data, indicates that the model could serve as a valuable tool for design optimization to achieve the required SOFC performance.
Titulo: A tubular segmented-in-series solid oxide fuel cell with metallic interconnect films: A performance study through mathematical simulations
